children.text: This event presents an interactive, audiovisual exploration of Arturo Ripstein’s

, focusing on the film’s portrayal of transfemininity within the social and political tensions of 1970s Mexico. Through a combination of an introductory essay and detailed, timestamped annotations, the project guides participants through key scenes that illuminate how gender variance, desire, spectacle, and violence intersect on screen. Drawing on an intersectional approach informed by queer theory, trans studies, and media analysis, the event highlights the film’s visual strategies and historical contexts while inviting viewers to engage critically with its representation of La Manuela and the broader cultural forces shaping mexican transfeminine visibility.
